Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, But a Word of Caution”
Reviews.Author: RnD_Pittsburgh
Reviews.Content: This Spring Hill Suites by Marriott is conveniently located in downtown Indianapolis, practically connected to the convention center and within walking distance of great shops and restaurants. It shares a lobby area with its sister property the JW Marriott. A system of indoor skywalks makes it a joy to traverse center city in cold or inclement weather. The property and rooms are clean, featuring a family-friendly split bathroom design. The room decor is ultra contemporary, but not quite cheesy or distasteful. The staff was friendly and responsive enough and the free breakfast was above average increasing the value of our stay. A word of caution, though. One of our party developed a “dermatitis” on her lower leg during the hotel stay. She told her fellow staffers about it but did not inform me until we returned. Her son, a licensed commercial pest control operator, opined that her condition was likely caused by bites from bedbugs. A follow-up doctor’s examination ordered by our company could not rule out the possibility. Naturally, I informed the hotel who assured me that the room has been inspected by its pest control vendor and that there was no evidence of bedbugs (except, of course the bedbug-bite looking dermatitis on my colleague’s leg). Thought you’d like to know. Sleep tight.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and customer service made this an excellent buy!”
Reviews.Author: nancyhi
Reviews.Content: From the time of check-in until check out, the service was great and very accommodating. Also, the rooms are clean, large, and have almost everything you need. Its really nice to have two bathrooms, one with the toilet and the sink, and another with the bath and the sink, however, it would make more sense to me to put the amenities and the hairdryer in the room with the toilet rather than the bath area. This is so that while one person is showering, another person can be drying their hair without getting steamed out. And yes, if you close the door and run the shower, it gets steamy inside the room. Also, it would be nice if they would have put some amenities in the second bathroom so you're not running back and forth between them for stuff. Nitpicky things, but I wish they had a haircover and lotion. I didn't try calling the front desk for it, to see if it was available, but there was a small area for groceries and notions right next to the front desk if you wanted something at any time of the day. Beds were comfortable, and I asked for extra pillows and blankets, and only needed the pillows. Since I had recent neck surgery a month before this trip, I wanted extra cushioning and comfortable beds, and this fit the bill. I also asked for and received an accessible room, since I was using a walker, and also needed the railings to help in the bathroom. I also had a cane to get around for shorter distances, and had left my walker at check in, since we were rushing to get to the TGIF at night before it closed (arrived late at night off a delayed flight). Yes, its THAT close. I didn't even need my walker, it was right outside the door, and up the walkway about 25 yards! The check in agent offered to let me keep my things while we ate, so I left the luggage with him. When we came back an hour later, he had already transferred everything up to our room, making it so nice to just get myself upstairs and straight to room right next to elevator. And no, it didn't bother me to have the noise from the elevator, but the doors don't quite meet the rug at the bottom of the doorway, so if you're a light sleeper and sound bothers you, then you have to weigh your decision on whether you want or need to be close to the elevator vs the sound. BUT, there was a very inconsiderate guest across the way from us, who had allowed her kids (5-6 boys) to run around playing outside in the hallways. She brought this portable soccer goal, and they set it up right outside my door and used the long hallway to kick the ball down. I was from the west coast, so while it was about 8:30am, it was 5:30am to me,and we didn't get to sleep til well after 2 am after dinner and showers the night before. I didn't really enjoy being woken up by the sounds of boys kicking a ball around and rustling around by the door. I had opened it and looked at them shaking my head and asked them to move down the hall a bit. They did, but I was now awake, so I decided I might as well go get some treats at the breakfast bar before it closed at 9:30. SO, I used my walker knowing it would be easier to carry things in it and walking then to try and balance everything. I found lots of great stuff. They had juice, milk, coffee, danish, waffles, eggs, sausage, fruit cups (sealed) and fruits. I had grabbed plenty of everything, tossing it in the walker, and the girl who refilled the food offered to help me gather things. She noticed I was taking it upstairs to put in the room, and said to use a coffee cup since it was larger and had a cover, and we loaded everything in my walker's bin. I thought it was very considerate of her to help, and to give me the advice, when I knew she was busy. I took enough for me and my daughter, and figured to reheat it in the microwave, and also had the frig for the juice and fruit cups and fruit. My daughter loved having the fruit cups when she woke up while I was heating everything. she didn't care for reheated sausage and eggs, but it worked for me. I didn't bother with waffles, since there was a line and I didn't want to stand there waiting for it with my walker cuz I kinda blocked the area with it. there's not a lot of room to move around, or to sit, so I was actually happy with what I had, and was content to take it upstairs and eat it there. My daughter liked sleeping in, and eating next to the TV, and when i was done, I jumped on the internet and checked mail while she ate. So, everything worked out fine. We were there for a sporting meet at the Convention Center, so I chose this location for its proximity to the center, for the lower price. I was very happy with the results. Our friends stayed at the JW, paying about $25 more for the room per night, plus taxes, had no frig or microwave, had to pay for breakfast and all their other food, as well as internet. They were closer to the center, and had a nicer room, but paid the extra money for everything and had 2 kids and could have used the savings of eating reheated food, and had no way of keeping their leftovers cold. We ate at a pizza place called Bazbeaux on Massachusetts Ave, while we went window shopping, and their pizzas were good, but huge, even for a small sized one! So we had tons of pizza left over. I was happy we had the frig and the microwave. But the other family was saying "hmm, no microwave... oh well, we like cold pizza. But, hmm, we don't have frig either... so I guess we'll have to leave it out." They thought about opening a window/balcony to put it on to keep it cold but couldn't because the JW is all windows on the outside. LOL We didn't have any problems - so I said I was happy to walk the few extra feet for the other conveniences. And we probably saved at least $100 over them. Oh, if you're walking around on Massachusetts, be sure to keep walking all the way up until you get to the Flying Cupcake! Great big huge red velvet cupcakes for about $3.75 each, about twice the size of the ones I've seen at home in Vegas. And they were good! I wanted to try their chocolate peanut butter ones, but someone right in front of us got the last one. Rats! she said it was one of their more popular flavors, so be sure to go earlier and grab some. Mmm. It cost about $19 for 5 cupcakes, but was our special treat for the day. Convention Center notes: It was cold at night when the meet was over, but no rain or snow (first week of Jan), so it was nice to have everything covered and inside. BUT, when leaving the convention center, you don't want to be the last ones out, because they lock the doors betw the center and the walkways, and we couldn't get into them and HAD to go outside to cross the street to the JW. It was freezing! But once inside the JW, were able to use the walkways from the JW to Springhill. It was 100+ yds to get to the back entry elevator of the Springhill, but with my walker, I was able to handle it. You're walking the length of the JW's convention area to get to the Springhill. There's a Starbucks too, right at the point of the JW's entrance to the convention center's walkway, so if you want to grab a coffee and munchie before heading in, do so - cuz there's nothing inside the center except expensive concessions that were down the hall from our event. (another 50-75 yds! no thanks, the coffee/hot chocolate and scones worked fine) We brought our ipod touch for communication since I couldn't carry the weight of my computer around with me this trip. I basically wanted to be able to access the internet for convenience, and check emails and post on Facebook. The Ipod did everything, and they had an ipod recharger unit on the radio. Wow, talk about convenience. Glad I brought the charger tho, cuz their radio unit wasn't charging it very well. But if you just need wireless internet for simple things, wow, the ipod touch saved me a lot of weight and extra gear i couldn't afford to bring. My 11 yr old daughter had to carry everything, so I definitely needed a hotel with services, and understanding staff, and I had to plan well. Since I did, and the staff was great, my trip was an easy one, and i couldn't ask for more. (except for the same inconsiderate guest - she let her boys play in front of my room again the second morning, even earlier. My guess is that the guests down the hall complained, so they moved their game in front of my door, extending it in the other direction towards the elevator. If you came off the elevator, you'd be greeted by nerf soccer balls and kids using the elevator area as the other goal. When I looked out my door, the mom was just packing stuff up and had her door open, so I commented with a "really? two mornings in a row? cmon..." and the boys said "oh, sorry" and continued to play. The mom said "they said they're sorry..." and let them continue. No apologies from her, no "boys, you need to play quietly, or stop." So, I decided to call the front desk and ask them to do something. They apologized, and i told them they didn't need to cuz its not the hotel's fault, they just needed to make them stop. I also told them itd be best to send someone up to see what the kids were doing. It took less than 5 minutes before that game was shut down. I was so tired, and being woken up so early again, I was pretty mad, so I called the front desk and asked if I could have an extra hour to get myself together and sleep for just a few more minutes. He said if its only an hour, then that was fine. The extra hour was plenty, I just needed a little buffer, because I couldn't get everything packed that fast. When I checked out a couple hours later, the front desk asked if it had quieted down, or if there was any more trouble, and I said no. The front desk service was obviously very attentive, and knew exactly who was calling in, and remembered me, and asked if my stay was OK. Yes, it was - thanks to them. So, give them a chance to correct things, and I'm sure you'll have a great stay. BTW if you need a taxi, check online and get the phone number into your cell phone ahead of time. When you call them you can mention you saw their online ads for $25 to/from the airport, and that's what they'll charge, instead of $35+ for traffic and stops and mileage... I saved more than $10 one way, compared to our friends, who just caught the first taxi in the taxi line. But planning it next time, I'll call ahead a few minutes to allow for the guy to get there, because they needed 15-20 minutes to get to the airport, they weren't already there, and you don't catch the taxi in the same place - you need to walk further to another place to catch an arranged taxi ride. Our friend asked me how I got the deal, and wanted to do it going home.. and one driver warned her that you can't just hop in any taxi and say you want to pay $25. So he gave our friends the phone number so she could call for a return ride to the airport. It's also $5 for a ride anywhere within the downtown area - but some taxis charge extra if you have 5 people like we did since we traveled as a group and caught it outside the JW front lobby to Massachusetts Ave. BUT I used my taxi service phone # to arrange our return ride back, and he charged me $5 - no extra. if you're travelling with a limited budget, you can appreciate the savings, wherever they are. Hope this is helpful to other travelers, because I really relied on other comments to help plan my trip. If you're traveling following a surgery, sometimes you just need a little extra TLC and can really appreciate it when someone offers the little extras without having to ask for them or charge for every little thing you need, and that's how the Springhill Suites was. I can't guarantee everyone would receive extra service, but if you ask nicely, I'm sure if they can, they will. Also, I booked this trip early, but I'm a Marriott member, and received a notice that there was sale pricing at the hotel a few days before my trip, so I asked if I was able to change my reservation without losing my accessible room. Marriott made the change, and I got an additional discount, so instead of paying the regular $123 rate (AAA member price), I got the same room for about $103 per night. I saved about $50 for the weekend last minute because of the sale. So keep checking up to the time you travel, you might still find better rates if you're wanting to save a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Victoria M
Reviews.Content: We were here for two nights and enjoyed a comfortable stay. The staff was very friendly from the valets to the front desk to housekeeping. The hotel is decorated in a very modern, sleek, European style and the common areas are fresh, new and sparkling clean. The room itself felt a bit smaller than other hotels I've experienced in this chain but boasts all the features that make me love Springhills, like a large desk, sitting area with a couch, microwave and fridge. The refrigerator and microwave are perfect for those times when you order room service and would love to save the leftovers for a second day reheat. Breakfast in the morning was good, with a wide variety of options and coffee and tea are available all day in the lobby. Offering "room service" delivery from the TGI Friday's downstairs is a great touch, and an option that we enjoyed when we arrived exhausted after a long day of driving. The location of the hotel is fantastic, close to IUPUI, Lucas Oil Stadium and the zoo and our room had a lovely view of the White River State Park. Overall it was a comfortable, friendly place to stay and I would choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: Sean1960_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during Super Bowl, so every where was Very very busy. The staff and hotel stood up well from what was a full hotel. The parking was $27 for valet and $23 for self park. But because there was only valet, due to the SB being in town. The hotel only charged $23. Reception is very efficient and the staff friendly. The elevators can be a bit slow in busy periods. The rooms are long and narrow with a small window which only goes half way across the width of the room. So that the rooms can be a little bit dark if you want natural light.The TV is placed to one side. So that you can watch from the bed of swivel it around and watch from the L-shaped sofa. Separate bathroom and toilet. Microwaves and fridge is good. The coffee maker is a one person machine. Which is a drawback if there are two of you. Coffee can be had from reception and is on tap 24/7. There is a Starbucks next door at the Courtyard if you need it. There is no safe in the room though you have the option to use a safe in reception. Wi-fi reception is good and reasonably fast, easy to connect to. Breakfast is great and there is a lot to choose from, hot and cold. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “SpringHill Suite Downton Indy”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: Attending an Indiana Pacers game a couple days ago, my son and I stayed at the SpringHill Suites in Downtown Indianapolis. This is actually the nicest SpringHill Suites that I have stayed in. The decor is very modern, which is definitely supported since this a newer hotel. It is an odd, but functional, arrangement for these 3 Marriott hotels. The entrance for this SpringHill Suites is shared with a Courtyard and they are both attached to the more upscale JW Marriott. Parking is below the hotel or for a couple dollars more you can Valet park. I have stayed at the Courtyard side of the hotel before but this was my first time at the SpringHill Suites side. The suite is not overly large but functional. You do not get the luxury of being able to close off the bedroom from the sitting area but since our purpose was simply a decent place to stay for the night this hotel more than fit the bill. There is a separate desk area for the wireless, a small fridge and microwave and a couch with a pull out bed. The toilet are is separate from the shower area which is unique but watch the sliding wooden doors if you need total privacy as they don't seem to close fully. The TV is situated in an odd location I think in what was a cost cutting move. I had a double/double suite and the TV was on a table at the foot of the bed close to the sitting area and it was on a swivel so that those on the couch can spin the TV around to watch. If you are like me you will need to keep your glasses on to watch TV if you have the bed farthest from the door as it the TV is not large and it is way off to the left if you are viewing from bed. They offered breakfast in the morning but I took advantage of the late checkout and therefore can't comment on the breakfast. I am actually originally from Indianapolis and know the city quite well. Whenever I come to town for a Pacers game or Colts game I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Option....by an Indianapolis Area Resident”
Reviews.Author: jlnjz
Reviews.Content: We had a family event that brought 6 families to Indianapolis and, even though we live just outside of Indy, we decided to stay here as well. The hotel did a great job working with us on a block of rooms. Their price was very competitive and the suite set-up was ideal for families with multiple kids. We planned to attend various events and the Springhill Suites proved to be a great location. Even as an Indy resident, I was a little skeptical of the ability (or desire) to walk everywhere. We attended an event on Monument Circle which, on a map, looks like quite a walk if the weather were cold. We were able to walk through the series of skywalks and the mall and it got us within a block or so of our destination without ever having to put on a coat. We also had tickets to basketball games at Conseco Fieldhouse and this gave us a great head start to getting that far away from the hotel. If you have events at Lucas Oil Stadium, the Convention Center, or are visiting the museums or the zoo this location will be ideal. The rooms were very nice. They have these couch/chaise lounge type things in the living room area. They didn't look very comfortable in the picture but they were very comfortable! The bathrooms are divided into a room with toilet and sink and a room with sink and shower -- great when sharing with a family. There was a nice desk area that we used quite a bit. The exercise room and the pool were very nice. Although we didn't ask for one, I noticed that the rooms have the option to be connecting rooms which is great if you have a family that is larger than one room can accommodate. They offer a nice breakfast along with the room but you're also connected to the JW Marriott and the Courtyard if you want a different option. We love the Marriott chain but have never stayed at a SpringHill Suites. We would definitely stay at one again. Also, as a resident of the area, I don't often have the opportunity to see the city like this but we had a room that faced the JW Marriott and it was a beautiful view of the downtown area

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to a lot in downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: habsmom
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything the Springhill Suites had to offer. We stayed two days in November with extended family. We enjoyed the lobby area with the TVs and games offered to guests. It was nice to have the choice to stretch out in the lobby area or upstairs in the connecting suites. The pool is small but does its job. The hotel is within walking distance of the Zoo, Victory Field, the beautiful Indiana State Museum, Lucas Oil Stadium, the Eiteljorg, the Convention center and Circle Center Mall. The staff were great. Check in/Out was easy. Parking is convenient. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NTW8
Reviews.Content: A very clean, new hotel. The rooms were huge with a seperate sitting/tv area with a refrigerator and microwave. Very chic decorating. I LOVED that there were two seperate sinks in two seperate rooms within the room so two people could get ready at the same time. A very well designed hotel. The indoor pool was adequate, nothing fancy, kind of small. My only complaint during my stay was that I asked for one more additional hour before I had to check out the next day, and they would not give me one additional hour. They wouldn't budge. I ran the Monumental Marathon and needed to take a shower afterwards. They said the hotel was sold out the next day and they had to make up the rooms. Really they can make up all the rooms within the first hour of guests checking out? They said noon was check out and that's that. That was the only disappointment of my stay which was a huge inconvenience. I had to walk a mile to take a public shower at the local YMCA. The hotel itself was clean, in a great central location, within walking distance to restaurants, shopping, and the room was awesome. Just never need an additional hour to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: gcmanke2
Reviews.Content: My family and some friends spent the weekend here over Halloween weekend - it could not have been more enjoyable. Check-in was quick & friendly. The clerk noticed my little girl right away and offered her a small toy & some candy. That was really nice. The room was large, well furnished (3 beds when you pull out the sofa-bed), and impeccably clean. The shower and vanity are separate from the toilet - this is very helpful when travelling with 3 kids and 2 adults. One of my favorite things about this hotel is that it connects to the JW Marriott, and from there to the Convention Center, Lucas Oil Stadium, and the mall. It was nice enough outside to walk outdoors, but I will definitely remember this the next time I'm in the area in the winter. The free breakfast area was kept up well - the food was fresh and (with one exception) tasty. The once exception being the "egg patties" - some kind of pre-formed slab of an egg like substance. Yikes. Finally, the hotel was surprisingly quiet - we were there at the same time as a couple of high school sports teams. Yet we didn't hear a peep out of them. The only noise issue occurred Saturday night when someone came back home drunk and thought he needed to bang his head against the wall. That's not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: sleepy99
Reviews.Content: Every employee was friendly. The room was immacculate and spacious--hotel booked so they gave us handicapped which had tub and shower...Newly reomodeled with fun decor. Couch/desk/coffee/fridge area--plenty of living space. Free internet and breakfast a plus which is rare with hotels this close to all the action. Breakfast good--sausage patties, eggs, muffins, waffles, cereals, fruit, yogurt, juices and coffee. Parking was the only downfall--only valet due to being full.. we opted for 10 dollar parking across the street. We walked easily to the zoo, the mall and the university's Natatorium.

Reviews.Title: “My family will always stay at Springhill Suites when visiting Indianapolis!”
Reviews.Author: Bizzette
Reviews.Content: I came to Indianapolis to visit a specialist at the University of Indiana Hospital. From the minute we entered this hotel, my family and I were impressed with the look and cleanliness of the Springhill Suites in downtown Indianapolis. Every employee we encountered was pleasant, helpful, and extremely friendly, The beds were comfortable, the pillows, were exquisite, and the view was breathtaking. The hotel was within walking distance to various types of recreation. If we ever return we know we will be staying at the Springhill suites!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Reasonable Stay”
Reviews.Author: vickeya
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my husband chose to stay at SpringHill Suites in downtown Indianapolis. Despite being booked in a room closest to the elevators during a busy, 24-hour a day convention (Gen Con), it was quiet. We were delighted by TGI Friday's being the room service. It gave us a chance to have food delivered that exceeds our expectations of hotel food. Speaking of which, as was the case last year, they didn't have enough food at the free buffet in the morning to keep up with the number of people coming through at the same time. I'd hoped that was just a glitch from having just opened, but it wasn't any better this time. Otherwise, it's what I expect from a Marriott: clean, spacious, and with a couple of niceties. The very small fridge isn't enough to keep many leftovers, but it does keep fruit and drinks cold. I was disappointed that you have to wiggle through a maze of pathways, elevators, and halls to get to the skywalk, but it's better than having to be outside if it's raining or exceedingly warm and you're carrying stuff! The free printing from the lobby computer was a great amenity, but they underestimated the printing needs and didn't re-fill the cartridges over three days of sketchy printing. Overall, still a good stay and I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, and modern. Great for business travel!”
Reviews.Author: JMP10910
Reviews.Content: I stayed for just one night at the SpringHill Suites last November when in town for business, and was extremely happy I chose this hotel. It was practically brand new and felt exceptionally clean. I loved the setup of the room, which had a couch, coffee table, TV, and desk that was nicely separated from the bed/sleeping area and great for getting some work done. Bathroom was squeaky clean and convenient. I picked this hotel over several others because even with the free in-room internet, free breakfast, and 5 minute walk to the convention center where my meeting was, it was still more affordable than many other choices. The room service from the next door TGI Friday's was a nice perk as well. I'm going back in October and have known where I'll be staying for a year: the SpringHill Suites, of course!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was good!”
Reviews.Author: Luve2Travel35
Reviews.Content: PARKING: Valet parking really wasn't necessary. The garage entrance is just past the main/valet area (which is quite small for the number of cars using these hotels). While the signage isn't great when you are on top of it, from a distance you'll see a large parking sign attached to the side of the building. The parking area is color coded according to your hotel, as the same garage is used for multiple hotels. It is convenient to park in your assigned color but definitely not necessary. No one checks to make sure you're in the correct area; you'll just be closer to the appropriate elevator/entrance to your hotel. Make sure you take a ticket when entering the parking garage. Take your ticket to the front desk where you'll be given an access card to swipe when leaving the garage. FRONT DESK: These people were awesome, making arrangements for an additional night's stay for us. They called 10 minutes after check-in to make sure everything was OK. Everyone was friendly and helpful, even at midnight when we were returning from a local event. We asked a question and found the answer on a hand-written card, placed under our door, the next morning. The only problem we had was that there was a major event going on in Indy the weekend we visited. I loved that guests were given a letter asking for quiet and respect for non-event guests (i.e. quiet hours). That same letter included information about a parade taking place over the weekend. Sadly, the wrong location was given for the parade, and many guests ended up in an empty park on Saturday morning. ROOM: The room set-up is unique. As others have mentioned, there is a small bathroom with a toilet and pedastal sink. The other bathroom has a full vanity counter top, shower and bath. It would be nice for the smaller bathroom to have counter space, allowing two guests to get ready at the same time. The way it's set up now, there is no room for a brush, toothbrush, razor or anything else in the smaller bathroom. It seems that this set-up is rather unnecessary, but it was fine. The sitting area was larger than most, with an L-shaped sofa bed. There was a microwave and tiny fridge in the room. The view of the river and park was beautiful. On a Saturday morning we watched quite a few people attempting to ride Segways all over the park. Lots of people were out walking/running, etc. AREA: Everything was nice, safe and convenient. There is a walkway to the Convention Center, different parking garage, etc. Walking to Lucas Oil Stadium is possible as well. The park across the street was very nice. If you want coffee, wander through the many halls of this hotel complex to get to Starbucks. Finding one outside of the hotel was difficult. Indy was surprisingly quiet on a Saturday. RESTAURANTS: We ate at the Fridays in the hotel and one of the restaurants in the connecting JW Marriott (sports bar and grille). While our Marriott hotel waiter was friendly, he was incredibly inefficient. He described the entrees incorrectly, dropped a tray, lost my credit card, and forgot to return with the bill. There is a continental breakfast in the hotel. As others have said, you will walk in and see a very long line. This is only for the waffle makers. Feel free to go around the line if you don't want waffles. There were eggs, sausage patties, bagels and all the usual stuff. The food area is quite small, but there is ample seating for guests. RECREATION: We did not use the fitness center. The pool was very, very small and shared by all the hotels in the complex. OVERALL: Clean room but not spotless, convenient, friendly, reasonable, great!

Reviews.Title: “So new, so clean! $23 to Park!”
Reviews.Author: NinaJ56
Reviews.Content: My pal and I just needed a one night stay and the hubby let go of a few "Reward" points so our stay was FREE! That isn't actually true, they rape you with the parking, $23 for overnight parking, glad it was only one night. One would think if you are staying at their hotel, the parking would be FREE! Less than 15 from the airport, nice free breakfast, very new, still very clean. The thing I found the most fascinating was that all of the Marriott properties were connected in this complex and yes it is like a complex. Accessible and comfortable smoking area for you smokers. Check in was easy, the guy at the desk failed to tell us we would need to use the room key to get us up to the 11th floor. Now I realize if we had just read the sign when we got into the elevator we would have known, but we were dead tired after 7 hours on the road......just a thot! Every Marriott property I stay at my only complaint are the beds. With their buying power one would think that they could put DECENT, COMFORTABLE beds in their properties and I don't mean the linens, I mean the actual mattress! The room was very well lite, including the bathrooms. Plenty of room, large work/desk area with a comfortable chair, even our view from the room was great. For those of you looking for a place to stay for the 2012 Super Bowl, this is a good location and the rooms are huge, even had a sofa sleeper, just be prepared for the parking fees.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: UB32UNC
Reviews.Content: Nice location, nice rooms & good service. Its located across from NCAA/Convention Center and close to everything else in Indy. Family stayed here for my Sister's wedding. Front Desk was always willing to help w/whatever questions we asked. Wii downstairs, indoor pool, ATM, Grocery Store etc. All the Marriott Hotels are connected so Parking can be a pain in Parking Garage. Will come back again if we spend night in Indy. Clean, friendly staff etc. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel suites In downtown Indy for a decent price!”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisMailman
Reviews.Content: I was looking at the Marriott website, I chose Springhill suites for its location and price. Springhill suites is connected to two other Marriott hotels. There is plenty of parking, you don't have to valet your car to save a couple of dollars. I have to admit it was a little confuseing when trying to exit from the indoor parking lot. Parking your car is $23.00 a day for self-park. The hotel itself is new, from what the website said I believe it was built 2010. So it is modern, bright and airy it is not a fancy hotel. There is a continental breakfast for free in the morning. Beware of the waffle maker there is only one and you have make it yourself. By pouring the batter mix in the waffle maker and it take four minutes. So at times there is a line for it and whats taking so long looks from people. The rooms are nice and modern good in size. Their are sliding doors, ipod radio, and a flatscreen t.v. Also a small area for working in and a sofa. Microwave and small fridge in the room. There is a seperate washroom and a seperate bathroom with no exhaust vent. So if you use a lot of hot water be prepared for a sauna in your room for a couple of minutes. It is in a great location with parks within view from my 12th floor room. TGI Fridays within the hotel area. Tip if you go to TGI go outside the hotel, instead of going thru a maze of halls within the three hotel complex. The pool is small the shallow height is 3ft and the max depth is 4ft. Good for people and children that don't know how to swim. There is no hot tub which was a suprise. The workout room is modern and open 24hrs a day. Customer service is great and hotel clean without the wear and tear for a hotel after a couple of years. Great hotel and great location for the price without the JW Marriott price which it is connected to.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern place-great location!”
Reviews.Author: momomluv2go
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night a couple of weeks ago with my boys and husband. Loved this place! It was right across the street from 2 museums and the canal. It was so pretty and modern. Our room was great! I loved the separate shower and toilet area. I didnt get to check out the breakfast. My only concern was I thought Springhill Suites had 2 tv's in the rooms, but apparently they are changing this. I am disappointed about this because that was great when you had children, there could be options. We walked along the canal, which was clean and beautiful. Greatly recommend renting a paddle boat and paddling up and down the canal-we did it-it was FUN!

Reviews.Title: “very good property and area”
Reviews.Author: btravel93
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a couple here without our kids for one night. We had a room with a tub. He asked if I had a room preference and I said, a room with a view. He gave me room 1241. It had a tub, with a bar to hold to get in. I'm not sure if it was rated handicapped or not. So if you have kids and want to stay here, there you go. And the room definitely had a nice view. Everything about the room was really nice. We went to a concert in the park. We had been waiting in line and been outside for almost 6 hours. It felt really good to come back to such a nice inviting space. The shower was great. We had nice glass cups. Breakfast was awesome with things that usually aren't offered, such as oatmeal with walnuts, and berry sauce for the waffles. We liked the split bathrooms okay. The tv placement while not super ideal was not bothersome and I can see why its placed in the middle like that. This is such a nice place and location that I had to decide if it would be a place I would travel with my kids. I might during the week. It was a Friday around 3 when we arrived. My kids like the pool, but are hesitant about water. The pool while nice, and smaller, and shared with the courtyard next door. There were about five late teen boys in the area. The stairs are right when you walk in. We would not have felt comfortable trying to relax in there. The next morning it was more empty. Get to breakfast early. We arrived a little after 730 am on a Saturday to eat. When we came back to the lobby for wifi at around 840 it was teeming with people from various groups getting ready for their day. The seating was filled in the breakfast area and couch area. It was a nice area though. It held everyone nicely and they had games for the kids. PARKING - I was a little worried about the whole parking situation. I knew I could leave my car with the valet, but I wanted to try to park it myself. The entrance to the garage is RIGHT past the place where you would pull into the valet area, right around that corner, you drive right down into the garage. Which way to go when it the garage was not clearly marked . The only signage when we fist pulled in was a color coded level indicator telling you where to park depending on what hotel you were staying in. We were level green. Well we got to stay right on the bottom but there was limited signage saying PARK, or EXIT. There was some on the way out, but I think it be more clearly labeled. At one point when we pulled in, we weren't sure we were even in a real parking spot because there were not lines on both sides. We moved next to a pillar on the lower level. At 530 they had the garage closed off with barricades not allowing people to enter, I assume it was full. We parked with the intention of not driving again until we left so it was fine. Food - Plenty of food. We went to Friday's and it was really good. We also saw their employee's delivering food. We walked past the Bistro area and there was Starbucks sign but we didn't go there. The coffee at breakfast was also the best I have had at a hotel. WIFI Go to the lobby first for wifi, and I think then with the passcode you can get it in your room from their website. Also it is free wired in your room. What to do - Go to the Indiana State Museum across the screen. It is only 14.00 for a couple and worth it. We had a nice morning there. The park outside is also gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: blsl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend getaway and had a great time. The rooms are comfortable; however, the bathroom does not have a bathtub and the shower/sink is separated from the toilet/sink (and no, the sink is not very big or deep, so families with toddlers who don't do showers may want to bring their own basin or travel tub for bathing). Staff were very warm and friendly. There is valet parking, however, it wasn't always readily available when we pulled in; the hotel is adjacent to Courtyard Marriott, so I think they may share valet services (they share parking garage, too, I believe). The hotel entrance is a bit tricky to maneuver and gets quickly backed up so you may want to just park your car in the parking garage and go check in, rather than try to pull into the valet/entrance loop (especially during heavy traffic hours).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience overall”
Reviews.Author: kycoltsfan
Reviews.Content: While I have stayed in other Indianapolis Marriott properties, this was my first stay at the Springhill downtown. The location is near the convention center and shopping but would require a little walk, however there are walkways connecting a lot of it. If you are planning on visiting the zoo, this would be a great location. The hotel is fairly new which is reflected in the modern decor. The driveway is very small and shared by the Courtyard Marriott. Valet parking was available and service prompt and friendly. Checkin was quick and the staff was very helpful and pleasant. The room was a little different than other Springhill Suites in that there were two sinks, a small one in a room with the toilet and another large vanity in a room with the shower. When traveling with a family, we found this to be a nice change as several members could be getting ready at once. Other amenities which we enjoy are the free internet, microwave and refrigerator, as well as the sitting area with a desk. Another perk is that breakfast is included. While we have found other hotels to be cramped in the breakfast area, this hotel seems to have taken this into account and expanded the eating and lobby area to make the experience more pleasant. The breakfast options were varied and plentiful and included breads, pastries, yogurts, hot and cold cereal as well as fruit, waffles, meat and eggs. Another unusual treat was that the breakfast area had attendants that assisted with anything you needed as well as cleanup.While most of our stay was pleasant, there were however two negatives about the hote,. First, the indoor pool was very cool. We had looked forward to letting our toddler swim but could only sit on the steps since the water was not warm enough. Secondly, I left an adapter for a charger plugged in at the desk in our room. I called the hotel within 24 hours to see if they could retrieve this for me and I would pick it up during another visit to the area. I was told that they would notify housekeeping who would let me know if they found the item. When I didn't hear anything back, I again called two days later and re-explained the problem to someone at the desk. I was assured that she would personally look into it and let me know one way or another. I never received a call. While I realize it is my fault that I left the item, it seems that it would have been easy enough to simply check and see if the adapter was still in the outlet or check with housekeeping. I would have appreciated a call even if nothing was found. While the customer service was great during the stay, I feel it fell a little short once we walked out the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSUGRAD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference and the hotel was excellent. Stay was always willing to help with a smile. Rooms were clean and spacious. Love the Springhill Suites Brand!! Great Job.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: ATMmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Springhill Marriott in Indianapolis a couple of weeks ago and were AMAZED! If you need a location near downtown Indy, any of the connected Marriotts will be a prime choice. The guest services went above and beyond! We decided to "tour" the various locations since the new JW had be opened for about 6 weeks. It is beautiful, I can't wait to stay there next month for work! Each staff member smiled, and it was not a forced/fake-I am here to work and they make me smile. Guest services were fluid-you pass between brands and still are treated with respect and amazing service. My favorite person was young mother working at the front desk of the Springhill. She was there the evening and the next morning, both days with a welcoming smile and extending her assistance for EVERYTHING! The lobby, with her kind conversation and the games provided for children, and the breakfast area were our favorite hang-outs! Kudos to each employee who goes above and beyond to make our family feel genuinely welcomed and comfortable! Please hold on to the sincerity that so many other hotels seem to have lost!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: kle1974
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! My 4 yr old daughter and I stayed for 2 nights and I couldn't be happier that I chose this hotel! I've stayed in a few other downtown hotels but this was the best for my daughter and I! The room was very nice and we had a great view of the city. Ask for room 1544 if you are staying in a King room. I believe that room has the best view! The breakfast was good enough for us but I did notice they ran low on plates and bowls but they were quickly replaced when asked. The front desk staff were very friendly and always smiling and telling us to have a good day! We used the pool a few times. It is very small but we were the only ones in there so it was perfect for us! There is a TGIF connected that had great food and we ended up eating there for dinner every night! There is an IMAX right across the street that I would recommend if you're looking for somehting to do. We walked over there so there was no need to take a cab! I would recommend this hotel to anyone! We loved it and will stay there next time we are in Indy!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: homeykat
Reviews.Content: We were in Indy for a cheerleading competition. The hotel is convenient to the convention center, it will be better when the JW Marriott opens and the skywalk is opened. I had reserved 2 double beds, when I got to my room it was a king. I called the front desk and they put us in a handicap room since we already had our luggage on that floor. The room was huge. It was clean and I appreciated the mini fridge. My only complaint with the room was the bathroom and shower doors being opaque glass and sliding open and close, it was hard to be quiet in the middle of the night. I liked the breakfast, that was a money saver for us. We were in town for a cheerleading competition and although the hotel was full of cheerleaders, it was still quiet. The valet were wonderful, my car was nice and warm when it was time to go. This was a stylish and clean hotel, I plan on staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek hotel at a great value”
Reviews.Author: peacepax
Reviews.Content: I travel to Indianapolis for business often and this is one of my favorite places to stay. Very clean rooms and good service. Sleek and trendy style. Great view of the river and park. Hotel is by museums and parks. Convenient in and out parking which is not as pricey as other downtown hotels. People have made complaints about parking costs but downtown Indianapolis is expensive. The free breakfast is a bonus which makes this hotel a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay again...NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: tripsemf
Reviews.Content: Bear in mind when traveling that you cannot control who ends up in the neighboring room. The hotel was packed the weekend we arrived and we couldn't switch rooms or move to another hotel. I never really thought about "thin walls" - we have never really had an issue with noise levels when we've travelled. This one building houses both the Springhill Suites and the Courtyard hotels. We found out at checkout that Springhill is their "luxury" side, and the Courtyard is geared towards business travelers (ie. quiet). We were SO UNFORTUNATE to book at the Springhill, and to be given a room next door to really noisy/unconsiderate family. We stayed 2 nights and had to call the front desk both nights to tell them to keep quiet. Once was at 1:30 am and the other night was at 3 am...and they had two little kids, to boot! Horrible - got no sleep...and I had my 4 young children with me. The desk manager was prompt and very polite - but the walls are seriously lacking any kind of soundproofing - kind of ridiculous if you are gearing the place towards families. I really recommend staying elsewhere if you can. Had I known, I would have paid the extra $$ to stay somewhere that I could have had a decent night's sleep and not have to listen to other people's children scream and whine all night...and into the morning. That being said, the location is great: across the street from museum, just a few blocks from the mall with theaters. New, so it's completely updated and clean; friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive stay in convenient area”
Reviews.Author: CultureTraveller13
Reviews.Content: I loved the lobby and the color scheme throughout and the views. I loved the iPod dock and big desk and many different areas and free internet. It's nice that there's a separate powder room. I just didn't love the frosted glass on the bathing room, since light from it can wake up others in the same room. However, overall the hotel was fantastic -- quiet and pleasant. And it's incredibly close to several museums, just across the street or a block or so away. (Note if you need a quick meal and don't want to go out, there is an informal bistro? in the attached hotel also by Marriott, though I didn't try it.)

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Lucas Oil Stadium”
Reviews.Author: bracy2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a convenient place to stay if going to a Colt's game. Not as expensive as some of the downtown hotels, but within walking distance to the stadium. Still a little distance to walk to the Circle Center area though. I'm sure when the construction is complete the hotels will "flow" a little more, but right now it is a little confusing as to where to enter from outside and how to get around. The room was nice of course with everything being new. A little awkward layout with the TV being in the middle (in a king sized room), so if our child was with us we would've had to be all in the bed or all on the couch, or watch it at an angle. The toilet and shower are in separate bathrooms with a sink in both...we couldn't decide if we liked that or not? The room was bigger than a standard size but don't think with the separate seating area that it is a really large room. We did not use the pool or fitness center, the pool looked a little small if you would be there on a busy weekend (I think it is shared with the Courtyard)? The continental breakfast was good, not a restaurant but definintely better than others we have been to. We were not at the hotel very much and only stayed one night, so we did not use all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent to Indiana State Museum // OK Hotel but would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: kathy884
Reviews.Content: We took a weekend trip to Indianapolis over the weekend of Oct. 29-31 to visit the Titanic Artifact Exhibit at the Indiana State Museum. The hotel was very convienent for this right across the street, and we just walked over which was great. The hotel is in a great location for doing anything at White River State Park. Other hotel positives: - Very clean - Excellent maid service - Spacious comfortable room (There were only three of us though, but plenty of room for us // more room than in a standard hotel room) -- TGI Friday's right next door and room service from TGI Fridays available // could also walk to Courtyard resturant // so food options onsite // Courtyard was connected to Springhill Suites and used the same pool. Not as positive // mostly minor annoyances, but there were enough of these that we'd pick another hotel next time -- beeps for every floor you pass when going up on the elevator -- breakfast was a mob scene both mornings -- no tables but we were able to sit on one of the lobby sofas -- pool was colder than most indoor hotel pools -- parking in the garage was a real pain // tough to find a spot and it was $20 a day. We did the valet parking to make things easier ($25 per day), but one time we had to wait over 20 minutes for our car. It was another mob scene with tons of people heading for a wedding and waiting for their cars. The turn around area for valet parking is way too small for the amount of activity -- cars coming in and out -- My husband hated the bathroom design. One room with a toliet and sink and another room with a sink and bath/shower, but you have to go into the main bed area to get from one to another. I actually, though, think some larger families might like the design with two places to be able to change clothes. -- No towel racks and just one small hook for hanging a towel. That meant hand towels, wash cloths, bath towels all had to go there if someone was taking a shower or on the floor. There were no notes about hanging up towel to reuse them and be more green like we see in most other hotels we stay in, but then there was really no place to hang towels period. -- No exhaust fan in the bathroom, so mirrors get really fogged up. -- Beds were fine, but a little firmer than I like. -- Called front desk for wake up call, but gave up after 20 rings with no answer. My husband said, "It just doesn't seem like they have their act back together yet." Really an OK place to stay (not a place to run away from or anything like that) // We, though, for another Indy stay would try another place.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: scottandabby419
Reviews.Content: A very nice new hotel by Marriott. The room was very modern but seemed kind of small when traveling with two children. We purchased zoo tickets with our room on Marriott.com which saved us money and we walked to the zoo from the hotel so saved us more money on the $8 parking at the zoo! The hotel is across from a park and the canal district which we loved. We took the kids down there and walked around for awhile very nice kind of forget that your near the downtown of a large city. As far as the valet parking you can self park the parking garage is below the hotel so you don't have to walk very far but pay attention at check-in when they tell you about using the elevators because there is two hotels here and the elevators our color coded one color for the Spring Hill and one for the Courtyard not a big deal you can kind of get turned around cause we made that mistake. Also there is a TGI Fridays on the property so that was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome town”
Reviews.Author: GolfProVa
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Indy for a week long conference. We stayed in the Spring Hill Suites by Marriott and this place is new and trendy. The rooms were clean and there were three of us in a room with two queens and a pull out sofa and we still had plenty of room. Our hotel was within one block of the conference. Everything we did was within an easy walking distance from the hotel. We actually sampled 15 different bars while we were there. My favorite bar was probably either Howl at the Moon or the Kilroy's on the corner across the street from Howl at the Moon. This bar had a shuffle board table inside and awesome food. We walked down to the public library and from the sixth floor you can look out on the city. The sixth floor has ceiling to floor glass to look out. Cool library by the way. Just an overall awesome time I had in Indy, did attend the game between the Manning brothers, that was fun as well.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get much better than this”
Reviews.Author: idclaire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed at. We were in town for RibAmerica Festival and it was within walking distance (around 3 blocks) which was very convenient. I was concerned from other reviews that parking was confusing. We didn't find that at all. We pulled right up to the hotel and a valet was there who gave us instructions. Parking was $20.00 if you do it yourself. We chose valet parking as it was only $5.00 more. Saved us the hassle. Check in was wonderful. Friendly and fast and very very helpful. The lobby is spacious and lovely. The rooms are the same. Beautiful and spacious. Decorated in springy colors. We had a sectional sofa in one part of the room with decorative throw pillows and a large flat screen T,.V. The beds were very comfortable and lots of pillows. Room also had refrigerator and microwave. Everything was clean clean clean. Not a speck of dirt. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. I also saw a review that said the fact that the Courtyard, Fairfield, and Springhill are all connected which makes it very confusing. I did not find it confusing at all. Everything is clearly marked where one starts and the other begins. Each has it's outside door so I didn't find it confusing at all. There is also a TGI Fridays connected to the Fairfield part of the building which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at this new Spring Hill Suites”
Reviews.Author: Janice1978
Reviews.Content: Brought my niece and her two young children to Indy to see the Zoo & Children's Museum. This was a great location for the Zoo and a short walk to the Monument Circle. Everyone was very impressed with Indy and with this hotel. The layout of the room worked out great for us--Everyone seemed to have a "private" place to change, etc. The kids spent a lot of time in the pool and it looked very cleam. Breakfast in the morning was very abundant. I appreciate the key-operated elevator and didn't find it difficult to use at all. In fact, the kids enjoyed activating it with the key. The hotel is located a little off the beaten path, but Indy's downtown is so vibrant, that we felt comfortable walking several blocks at night, as well as walking the canal. We used valet parking and found it quite convenient. We'll stay re again.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel with amazing view of park and 3 beds”
Reviews.Author: Austexfamily
Reviews.Content: We visit family in Indy at least once a year. We normally stay at the Residence Inn on the Canal, but last time my kids complained about sharing the sleeper sofa and asked if there was a way they could each have their own bed. We chose the Springhill because it was the only hotel we could find with 2 queen beds + a fold-out couch. Also, it is part of the Marriott family so we got half our stay free with loyalty points. The unexpected surprise was the stunning view of White River State Park from our 15th floor room. It did remind me of the reflecting pools in DC and was especially gorgeous at dusk and after-dark. Our room and entire hotel had nice furnishings. The beds were comfy, even the fold-out, which was separated from the other beds by an opaque screen. The bathroom is split with a toilet and sink/mirror on one side of the closet and and shower and sink/mirror on the other side, both with sliding doors. This was very handy with a teen and tween girl. We expected a continental breakfast and were pleasantly surprised that the there also hot items: eggs, sausage, oatmeal, and make-your own waffle. The breakfast line could be better organized as the waffles created a bottle-neck, but that wasn't a big deal since we weren't in a hurry. You can easily walk to the canal, State Museum, Etiljorg, NCAA Hall of Champions, Victory Field, canal boat and surrey bike rentals, and even a couple of restaurants. The cafe at the Etiljorg was very pleasant with indoor and outdoor balcony seating overlooking the canal. Zoo and glass gardens with butterflies are maybe a 5 minute drive. The work-out room looks out to the small pool, which is handy for keeping an eye on older kids. Parking is $20 self-park and $25 valet and I didn't see any affordable off-site parking options. While it is steep, it is in line with other Indy hotels downtown. It was a little tricky for family members to find as there are many Marriott properties in the area and it shares a building with the Courtyard. A good landmark is that it is just past the giant red check mark sculpture. We missed the outdoor balcony and grill at the Residence Inn. My girls said that free cookies (like at Res. Inn) would have "enhanced their hotel experience". However, Springhill did offer free lollipops and free breakfast. Service was fine--no complaints. I admit Residence Inn was friendlier, probably since we have been going there for years and staff actually remember us from visit-to-visit. At the risk of seeming disloyal to Res. Inn, I think we found a new favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and New -- But Learn to Say "Sorry"”
Reviews.Author: ConnieHighland
Reviews.Content: Brand new, nicely decorated hotel situated right across the street from the Indiana State Museum. I liked the fact that there were two bathroom areas – one with a toilet and sink; the other with a vanity sink and tub/shower. Lines for breakfast were long since it is 17 stories and has the same basic set-up as the 3-story Springhill Suites I am used to. The one problem I had was that upon return to the room at 4:45 our room had still not been cleaned and we had no new towels. We were going to get ready for dinner so I called down to report it. Never once did anyone I talked to (desk, cleaning supervisor) apologize – I just got “We have a full house and the maids work until 6 p.m. You need to understand.” Lots of excuses. I told them that answer was unacceptable and I needed towels right away. The towels did show up and at 5:15 the maid came. I sent her away since we were getting ready. That is poor service and someone needs to teach the staff to at least say “sorry” and diffuse the situation that way and then solve the problem. That night a note was in my room from the manager finally apologizing and giving me 5,000 Marriott Rewards points. Well, at least that was better. On the whole, I would give them another chance, but they need to hire more cleaning staff. Not having a room cleaned by 5:30 is not acceptable by my standards.

Reviews.Title: “Hip & trends”
Reviews.Author: srohlfs
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in early June. Great hotel - very hip and trendy and within walking distance of heart of downtown. Parking lot to hotel is a slight bit confusing, and there's one tiny indoor pool shared between 2 large hotel properties. But enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “functional, plenty of space, good location”
Reviews.Author: Coachbill
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days for the NCAA Final Four. Decent location downtown although nearby construction made walking somewhat difficult. Large rooms with fridge a plus. Decent breakfast in the am. Note, was told I could catch the "green line" to the airport right in front of the hotel (it's $7 vs a $35 cab ride). Waited in the rain and never did see it. I'd stay here again, decent place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel made for a Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: 1PickyPerson
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a 4 night stay at Springhill Suites Downtown. I had a Conference at Convention Center. It was nice to park my car and be able to walk every where! There is still construction going on for the neighboring hotel, but it didn't affect guests. The rooms were extremely clean. Housekeeping did a wonderful job. I appreciated the little things, such as the plates/silverware, a cold refrigerator and the easily accessible outlets. I loved having the split bathroom too. The "sitting" area was comfy and I loved the flat panel tv. Good amount of channels available also. The work area was spacious and well lit. I liked the sliding partitions to be able to look out the window to the wonderful view also. The fitness room is open 24 hours and the pool was nice. The breakfast was great. Very clean and friendly staff. I liked the security of having to use a room key to use the elevator. The hotel was modernly decorated with the the earth-friendly material. I loved my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Brand new with great location, but funky rooms - possibly better for one”
Reviews.Author: jbtexas
Reviews.Content: The Springhill Suites in downtown Indianapolis in the new "Marriott Place" complex is a brand new, very high tech, modern hotel with a fantastic location. It is however, a bit on the "funky" side in terms of design, and the net effect is that the room is perhaps better suited to a solo traveler than a couple. The location is great. White River State Park is across the street to the North. The convention center is to the East and one block south. For sports fans, Victory Field is immediately south of the hotel, and Lucas Oil Stadium is a 10 minute walk. For most people visiting Indianapolis, the hotel's location will be hard to top. The hotel is brand new and the rooms have the latest tech amenities, including plenty of plugs for cell phones, laptops, etc. The alarm clock supports an i-Pod. The front desk staff was consistently helpful. Parking is underneath the hotel at a rate of $20 per night. The garage layout takes a bit of getting used to, but once you figure out the color coding for where to park for the Courtyard and Springhill Suites, versus which spots are more suited for the Fairfield or TGI Friday's, the layout is easy to follow, and it was easy to find a spot with a short walk to the elevator. In my view, the biggest negative of the room was the layout of the bathrooms. As noted in other reviews, the bathroom is split, with a counter / sink and shower area in one room and a commode and a small sink in another room. There was limited towel space in the commode section, leading me to question how two people - particularly neatniks - might survive in the room. Also, the only place to set luggage was on the sill beneath the window. On the whole, the room is nice, but I would rate it higher for solo travelers than couples or more. One huge service negative: prior to my check in, the maid did not check to make sure the alarm clock was set to off. I got a rude surprise at 5:20 am. Yes, I should have checked. But in my view, this is reflective of poor housekeeping service - although the room was otherwise clean. Two other cautionary notes. I checked in at 2:15 pm, and limited rooms were available. I understand the hotel was full the night before due to the 500 Festival Mini-Marathon, but one would expect better room availability by 2:15 pm. Secondly, the day I checked in, many Indianapolis downtown streets were closed due to the Mini-Marathon. The hotel staff was kind enough to send me (and presumably anyone else checking in that day) an e-mail advising of the street closures. One problem - the directions they sent would require driving the wrong way on a one way street. Might be good to work your own set of directions before arrival.

Reviews.Title: “very good all new”
Reviews.Author: magdalenabautista
Reviews.Content: supper chic and good for all family clean close to down town

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in downtown Indianapolis!”
Reviews.Author: TripMan810
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed two nights at this hotel just after the Final Four. The hotel is located on the west side of downtown and is adjacent to the Indianapolis Convention Center. It is in walking distance of downtown. Across the street from the hotel you have the NCAA national headquarters and the Indiana State Museum. The hotel is brand new and opened in February 2010. It is adjacent to Fairfield Inn and Courtyard By Marriott. All three hotels share an underground garage that sits beneath the hotels. Self parking in the garage is $20/day and valet parking is $25/day. There is a well appointed TGIFriday's located in the Fairfield Inn and you can dine there or have it delivered to your room through room service. The hotel is very well appointed and serves a continental breakfast every morning. Rooms are well appointed and are trendy. Each room has a large Phillips LCD HDTV with plenty of HD channels available. Free internet is available via Wi-Fi or wired connections. Wi-Fi signal strength is very good and download speeds were 1.5 Mbit consistently. The room has an independently controlled HVAC system with a digital thermostat, microwave, and small cube fridge. The bathroom design is somewhat interesting in that is a split bathroom. The main sink/vanity and tub are in one room and the toilet and small sink are located in another area. The beds were very nice with high quality sheets and coverings. The night stand contained a phone along with an iHome clock radio with iPod Dock. As for other features, a fitness room was available with a variety of equipment available. The hotel features a very small indoor pool that probably could safely fit about 20 people in it. A business center is available where you can check your e-mail and print off boarding passes. The lobby is well appointed with free coffee and wi-fi. The breakfast area was very clean and offered a variety of hot and cold items for breakfast. Typically scrambled eggs and sausage patties were available along with a do-it-yourself waffle machine. A variety of cereals, bagels, and juices were available as well. For dinner, as mentioned previously, a TGIFriday's is located over in the Fairfield Inn. Other restaurants are located in downtown and can be easily accessed by foot, car, or taxi. Overall, this was an excellent hotel with quiet, well appointed rooms and other ammentites.

Reviews.Title: “Give this place a try!”
Reviews.Author: chon
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work. This hotel just opened last week (Feb 2010), so everything is clean and nice. Besides for the newness, the design is very traveler friendly. Many outlets close to the desk, couch, and bed for working in your room. Designed with ergonomics in mind. If you know anything about Indianapolis, you know that there are generally not many dining choices unless you drive... TGIF is right next door. The fitness room is top notch! Everything is modern and updated.
